column1: Over some of the girls of the Great Shirley School there passed that morning a curious wave of excitement. Those girls who had joined Kathleen's society were almost now more or less in a state of tension. Once a week they were to meet in the quarry; once a week
column4: they were to meet in this sequestered spot. They knew well that if they were discovered they would run a very great chance of being expelled from the school; for although they were day scholars
column5: yet integrity of conduct was essential to their maintaining their place in that great school which gave them so liberal an education
column6: in some cases without any fees
column7: in all other cases with very small ones. One of the great ideas of the school was to encourage brave actions
